qas.question: What country has the longest version of a constitution?

context: In <a0_0><a2_0><b5_0><b6_0>India<b6_0/><b5_0/><a2_0/><a0_0/>, the longest constitutional text in the history of the world has governed that country since <a1_0>1950<a1_0/>. Although the Constitution of India may have been intended to provide details that would limit the opportunity for <b8_0>judicial discretion<b8_0/>, the more text there is in a constitution the greater opportunity the judiciary may have to exercise <a3_0><b7_0>judicial review<a3_0/>.<b7_0/> According to Indian journalist Harish Khare, "The rule of law or rather <b9_0>the Constitution<b9_0/> [is] in danger of being supplanted by the <a4_0>rule of judges<a4_0/>."
